thread.title: "Star Wars: The Force Awakens" Stars React Hilariously to New Trailer
thread.title_full: "Star Wars: The Force Awakens" Stars React Hilariously to New Trailer

title: "Star Wars: The Force Awakens" Stars React Hilariously to New Trailer
text:
"Star Wars: The Force Awakens" Stars React Hilariously to New Trailer Posted just a moment ago 
Lucasfilm (LOS ANGELES) -- Not only did fans freak out at the latest Star Wars: The Force Awakens trailer released Monday night, but so did the stars of the film. 
Actress Daisy Ridley, who watched the trailer on her phone while under the covers in bed, broke down crying in excitement over how much she loved the new clip. She posted the footage on Instagram . 
"My friend filmed my reaction. Totally emotional seeing it for the first time and so so so incredibly awed to be part of this incredible legacy #starwars #theforceawakens," she wrote as the caption. 
A video posted by @daisyridley on Oct 19, 2015 at 8:06pm PDT 
Ridley, a British actress who has only been professionally acting since 2013, portrays Rey. Reportedly, her character is a scavenger who trades her finds on the world of Jakku. In the trailer, it seems that the voice talking to her, asking her who she is, is Gwendoline Christie's Captain Phasma. As of right now, she has no last name and that could be curious moving forward. 
John Boyega also posted an amazing video of his reaction to the trailer. 
"THE TRAILER IS JUST EEEE ! Star Wars is back! g d l rd! You know what! Let me just relax because this kind God oooo! Lmao! Seriously congrats to everyone ! December 18th!" he wrote with his accompanying video on Instagram . 
A video posted by @john_boyega on Oct 20, 2015 at 12:02am PDT 
His character Finn is just as intriguing. In the latest trailer, Boyega's Finn is heard saying, "I was raised to do one thing," as he pulls off his Stormtrooper helmet. "But I've got nothing to fight for." 
We've seen him in Stormtrooper gear, so is he a turncoat siding with the Rebellion? We also see him pat backs with Oscar Isaac's resistance pilot, Poe Dameron. 
Producers are keeping details close to the vest, so we'll just have to wait patiently until the movie hits theaters December 18.
